title: Where the Book of Mormon Was Published
subtitle: By Jan Pinborough
short_title: Where the Book of Mormon Was Published
content: Where the Book of Mormon Was Published
Come with me to explore an important place in Church history!

On a summer day in 1829, Joseph Smith walked into a red brick building in Palmyra, New York, USA, where Mr. Egbert B. Grandin had a printing press. The Prophet had just finished translating the words on the gold plates, and he wanted Mr. Grandin to publish the first 5,000 copies of the Book of Mormon. By the next spring, the new book of scripture was printed and ready for people to read.
Luke S., age eight, visited the Grandin Building to learn the amazing story of how the Book of Mormon was published 183 years ago this month.
Luke’s favorite story from the Book of Mormon is about Nephi getting the brass plates (see

). He likes how Nephi worked hard to do what the Lord asked. Luke learned something similar about publishing the Book of Mormon. “I learned it wasn’t easy,” he said. “They had to put all the letters in upside down and backwards!”
